setDebug(self, enable)[source]¶

Enable/disable debugging in this wrapper

pinConfig(self, pinNr, direction, outputLevel='LOW')[source]¶

Raspberry Pi GPIO Configuration

sensorSPIConfig(self, cs_pin=0, speedKHz=100, spiMode=0, spi_16bit=True)[source]¶
read(self, registerAddress, length=0, sensorAddress=0, nbDummyBytes=0)[source]¶

It reads length data from register at registerAddress and returns a list

write(self, registerAddress, data, sensorAddress=0)[source]¶

It writes ‘data’ to register at ‘registerAddress’

getGPIOSoftVersion(self)[source]¶

It gets the GPIO module version

setGPIOWarning(self, enable)[source]¶

It enables/disables the GPIO warning messages

setGPIOclean(self)[source]¶

It sets a GPIO input/output settings clean

setPinSwitchState(self, pinNr)[source]¶

It toggles the signal level of the output pin number pinNr

getBoardInfo(self, PiRev=True, RAM=True, Rev=True, Type=True, Proc=True, Manuf=True)[source]¶

It gets Rpi information: Pi revision, RAM, Revision, Type, Processor, Manufacturer

set_masked_value(self, reg, bit, width, value)[source]¶

Return the modified temp_register value. The signal starts at ‘bit’ in the register, is ‘width’ bits long ‘Value’ should be assign to this signal

get_masked_value(self, reg, bit, width)[source]¶

Return the masked and shifted value from the reg. The signal starts at ‘bit’ in the register, is ‘width’ bits long ‘Value’ is the current value of the signal.

initMUX(self)[source]¶

GPIO 6, 13, 19, 26 is used by the MUX board. Only 16 address is available.

setMUX(self, address)[source]¶

GPIO 6, 13, 19, 26 is used by the MUX board. Only 16 address is available.
